The Proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:
undefined To learn wisdom and moral instruction, and to discern wise counsel.
undefined To receive moral instruction in skillful living,in righteousness, justice, and equity.
undefined To impart shrewdness to the morally naive,and a discerning plan to the young person.
undefined (Let the wise also hear and gain instruction, and let the discerning acquire guidance!)
undefined To discern the meaning of a proverb and a parable,the sayings of the wise and their riddles.Introduction to the Theme of the Book
undefined Fearing the LORD is the beginning of moral knowledge,but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
undefined Listen, my child, to the instruction from your father,and do not forsake the teaching from your mother.
undefined For they will be like an elegant garland on your head,and like pendants around your neck.Admonition to Avoid Easy but Unjust Riches
undefined My child, if sinners try to entice you,do not consent!
undefined If they say, “Come with us!We will lie in wait to shed blood;we will ambush an innocent person capriciously.
undefined We will swallow them alive like Sheol,those full of vigor like those going down to the Pit.
undefined We will seize all kinds of precious wealth;we will fill our houses with plunder.
undefined Join with us! We will all share equally in what we steal.”
undefined My child, do not go down their way,withhold yourself from their path;
undefined for they are eager to inflict harm,and they hasten to shed blood.
undefined Surely it is futile to spread a netin plain sight of any bird,
undefined but these men lie in wait for their own blood,they ambush their own lives!
undefined Such are the ways of all who gain profit unjustly; it takes away the life of those who obtain it! Warning Against Disregarding Wisdom
undefined Wisdom calls out in the street, she shouts loudly in the plazas;
undefined at the head of the noisy streets she calls,in the entrances of the gates in the city she utters her words:
undefined “How long will you simpletons love naiveté?How long will mockers delight in mockeryand fools hate knowledge?
undefined If only you will respond to my rebuke,then I will pour out my thoughts to youand I will make my words known to you.
undefined However, because I called but you refused to listen,because I stretched out my hand but no one paid attention,
undefined because you neglected all my advice,and did not comply with my rebuke,
undefined so I myself will laugh when disaster strikes you,I will mock when what you dread comes,
undefined when what you dread comes like a whirlwind,and disaster strikes you like a devastating storm,when distressing trouble comes on you.
undefined Then they will call to me, but I will not answer;they will diligently seek me, but they will not find me.
undefined Because they hated moral knowledge,and did not choose to fear the LORD,
undefined they did not comply with my advice,they spurned all my rebuke.
undefined Therefore they will eat from the fruit of their way,and they will be stuffed full of their own counsel.
undefined For the waywardness of the simpletons will kill them, and the careless ease of fools will destroy them.
undefined But the one who listens to me will live in security,and will be at ease from the dread of harm.Benefits of Seeking Wisdom
My child, if you receive my words,and store up my commands within you,
undefined by making your ear attentive to wisdom, and by turning your heart to understanding,
undefined indeed, if you call out for discernment – raise your voice for understanding –
undefined if you seek it like silver,and search for it like hidden treasure,
undefined then you will understand how to fear the LORD,and you will discover knowledge about God.
undefined For the LORD gives wisdom,and from his mouth comes knowledge and understanding.
undefined He stores up effective counsel for the upright,and is like a shield for those who live with integrity,
undefined to guard the paths of the righteousand to protect the way of his pious ones.
undefined Then you will understand righteousness and justiceand equity – every good way.
undefined For wisdom will enter your heart,and moral knowledge will be attractive to you.
undefined Discretion will protect you,understanding will guard you,
undefined to deliver you from the way of the wicked,from those speaking perversity,
undefined who leave the upright pathsto walk on the dark ways,
undefined who delight in doing evil,they rejoice in perverse evil;
undefined whose paths are morally crooked,and who are devious in their ways;
undefined to deliver you from the adulteress,from the sexually loose woman who speaks flattering words;
undefined who leaves the husband from her younger days,and forgets her marriage covenant made before God.
undefined For her house sinks down to death, and her paths lead to the place of the departed spirits.
undefined None who go in to her will return, nor will they reach the paths of life.
undefined So you will walk in the way of good people,and will keep on the paths of the righteous.
undefined For the upright will reside in the land,and those with integrity will remain in it,
undefined but the wicked will be removed from the land,and the treacherous will be torn away from it.Exhortations to Seek Wisdom and Walk with the Lord
My child, do not forget my teaching,but let your heart keep my commandments,
undefined for they will provide a long and full life,and they will add well-being to you.
undefined Do not let truth and mercy leave you;bind them around your neck,write them on the tablet of your heart.
undefined Then you will find favor and good understanding,in the sight of God and people.
undefined Trust in the LORD with all your heart,and do not rely on your own understanding.
undefined Acknowledge him in all your ways, 	and he will make your paths straight.
undefined Do not be wise in your own estimation;fear the LORD and turn away from evil.
undefined This will bring healing to your body,and refreshment to your inner self.
undefined Honor the LORD from your wealthand from the first fruits of all your crops;
undefined then your barns will be filled completely, and your vats will overflow with new wine.
undefined My child, do not despise discipline from the LORD,and do not loathe his rebuke.
undefined For the LORD disciplines those he loves,just as a father disciplines the son in whom he delights.Blessings of Obtaining Wisdom
undefined Blessed is the one who finds wisdom,and the one who obtains understanding.
undefined For her benefit is more profitable than silver,and her gain is better than gold.
undefined She is more precious than rubies,and none of the things you desire can compare with her.
undefined Long life is in her right hand;in her left hand are riches and honor.
undefined Her ways are very pleasant,and all her paths are peaceful.
undefined She is like a tree of life to those who obtain her,and everyone who grasps hold of her will be blessed.
undefined By wisdom the LORD laid the foundation of the earth;he established the heavens by understanding.
undefined By his knowledge the primordial sea was broken open,and the clouds drip down dew.
undefined My child, do not let them escape from your sight;safeguard sound wisdom and discretion.
undefined So they will give life to you,and grace to adorn your neck.
undefined Then you will walk on your way with security,and you will not stumble.
undefined When you lie down you will not be filled with fear;when you lie down your sleep will be pleasant.
undefined You will not be afraid of sudden disaster, or when destruction overtakes the wicked;
undefined for the LORD will be the source of your confidence,and he will guard your foot from being caught in a trap.Wisdom Demonstrated in Relationships with People
undefined Do not withhold good from those who need it,when you have the ability to help.
undefined Do not say to your neighbor, “Go! Return tomorrowand I will give it,” when you have it with you at the time.
undefined Do not plot evil against your neighborwhen he dwells by you unsuspectingly.
undefined Do not accuse anyone without legitimate cause,if he has not treated you wrongly.
undefined Do not envy a violent man,and do not choose to imitate any of his ways;
undefined for one who goes astray is an abomination to the LORD, but he reveals his intimate counsel to the upright.
undefined The LORD’s curse is on the household of the wicked,but he blesses the home of the righteous.
undefined Although he is scornful to arrogant scoffers,yet he shows favor to the humble.
undefined The wise inherit honor,but he holds fools up to public contempt.Admonition to Follow Righteousness and Avoid Wickedness
Listen, children, to a father’s instruction,and pay attention so that you may gain discernment.
undefined Because I give you good instruction,do not forsake my teaching.
undefined When I was a son to my father,a tender only child before my mother,
undefined he taught me, and he said to me:“Let your heart lay hold of my words; keep my commands so that you will live.
undefined Acquire wisdom, acquire understanding;do not forget and do not turn aside from the words I speak.
undefined Do not forsake wisdom, and she will protect you;love her, and she will guard you.
undefined Wisdom is supreme – so acquire wisdom,and whatever you acquire, acquire understanding!
undefined Esteem her highly and she will exalt you;she will honor you if you embrace her.
undefined She will place a fair garland on your head;she will bestow a beautiful crown on you.”
undefined Listen, my child, and accept my words,so that the years of your life will be many.
undefined I will guide you in the way of wisdomand I will lead you in upright paths.
undefined When you walk, your steps will not be hampered,and when you run, you will not stumble.
undefined Hold on to instruction, do not let it go;protect it, because it is your life.
undefined Do not enter the path of the wickedor walk in the way of those who are evil.
undefined Avoid it, do not go on it;turn away from it, and go on.
undefined For they cannot sleep unless they cause harm;they are robbed of sleep until they make someone stumble.
undefined For they eat bread gained from wickednessand drink wine obtained from violence.
undefined But the path of the righteous is like the bright morning light,growing brighter and brighter until full day.
undefined The way of the wicked is like gloomy darkness;they do not know what causes them to stumble.
undefined My child, pay attention to my words;listen attentively to my sayings.
undefined Do not let them depart from your sight,guard them within your heart;
undefined for they are life to those who find them and healing to one’s entire body.
undefined Guard your heart with all vigilance,for from it are the sources of life.
undefined Remove perverse speech from your mouth;keep devious talk far from your lips.
undefined Let your eyes look directly in front of youand let your gaze look straight before you.
undefined Make the path for your feet level, so that all your ways may be established.
undefined Do not turn to the right or to the left;turn yourself away from evil.Admonition to Avoid Seduction to Evil
My child, be attentive to my wisdom,pay close attention to my understanding,
undefined in order to safeguard discretion,and that your lips may guard knowledge.
undefined For the lips of the adulterous woman drip honey,and her seductive words are smoother than olive oil,
undefined but in the end she is bitter as wormwood,sharp as a two-edged sword.
undefined Her feet go down to death;her steps lead straight to the grave.
undefined Lest she should make level the path leading to life,her paths are unstable but she does not know it.
undefined So now, children, listen to me;do not turn aside from the words I speak.
undefined Keep yourself far from her,and do not go near the door of her house,
undefined lest you give your vigor to others and your years to a cruel person,
undefined lest strangers devour your strength,and your labor benefit another man’s house.
undefined And at the end of your life you will groanwhen your flesh and your body are wasted away.
undefined And you will say, “How I hated discipline!My heart spurned reproof!
undefined For I did not obey my teachersand I did not heed my instructors.
undefined I almost came to complete ruinin the midst of the whole congregation!”
undefined Drink water from your own cisternand running water from your own well.
undefined Should your springs be dispersed outside,your streams of water in the wide plazas?
undefined Let them be for yourself alone,and not for strangers with you.
undefined May your fountain be blessed,and may you rejoice in your young wife –
undefined a loving doe, a graceful deer;may her breasts satisfy you at all times,may you be captivated by her love always.
undefined But why should you be captivated, my son, by an adulteress,and embrace the bosom of a different woman?
undefined For the ways of a person are in front of the LORD’s eyes,and the LORD weighs all that person’s paths.
undefined The wicked will be captured by his own iniquities,and he will be held by the cords of his own sin.
undefined He will die because there was no discipline;because of the greatness of his folly he will reel. Admonitions and Warnings against Dangerous and Destructive Acts
My child, if you have made a pledge for your neighbor,and have become a guarantor for a stranger,
undefined if you have been ensnared by the words you have uttered,and have been caught by the words you have spoken,
undefined then, my child, do this in order to deliver yourself,because you have fallen into your neighbor’s power:go, humble yourself,and appeal firmly to your neighbor.
undefined Permit no sleep to your eyesor slumber to your eyelids.
undefined Deliver yourself like a gazelle from a snare,and like a bird from the trap of the fowler.
undefined Go to the ant, you sluggard;observe its ways and be wise!
undefined It has no commander, overseer, or ruler,
undefined yet it prepares its food in the summer;it gathers at the harvest what it will eat.
undefined How long, you sluggard, will you lie there?When will you rise from your sleep?
undefined A little sleep, a little slumber,a little folding of the hands to relax,
undefined and your poverty will come like a robber,and your need like an armed man.
undefined A worthless and wicked personwalks around saying perverse things;
undefined he winks with his eyes,signals with his feet,and points with his fingers;
undefined he plots evil with perverse thoughts in his heart,he spreads contention at all times.
undefined Therefore, his disaster will come suddenly;in an instant he will be broken, and there will be no remedy.
undefined There are six things that the LORD hates,even seven things that are an abomination to him:
undefined haughty eyes, a lying tongue,and hands that shed innocent blood,
undefined a heart that devises wicked plans,feet that are swift to run to evil,
undefined a false witness who pours out lies,and a person who spreads discord among family members.
undefined My child, guard the commands of your fatherand do not forsake the instruction of your mother.
undefined Bind them on your heart continually;fasten them around your neck.
undefined When you walk about, they will guide you; when you lie down, they will watch over you;when you wake up, they will talk to you.
undefined For the commandments are like a lamp,instruction is like a light,and rebukes of discipline are like the road leading to life,
undefined by keeping you from the evil woman,from the smooth tongue of the loose woman.
undefined Do not lust in your heart for her beauty,and do not let her captivate you with her alluring eyes;
undefined for on account of a prostitute one is brought down to a loaf of bread,but the wife of another man preys on your precious life.
undefined Can a man hold fire against his chestwithout burning his clothes?
undefined Can a man walk on hot coalswithout scorching his feet?
undefined So it is with the one who has sex with his neighbor’s wife;no one who touches her will escape punishment.
undefined People do not despise a thief when he stealsto fulfill his need when he is hungry.
undefined Yet if he is caught he must repay seven times over,he might even have to give all the wealth of his house.
undefined A man who commits adultery with a woman lacks wisdom,whoever does it destroys his own life.
undefined He will be beaten and despised,and his reproach will not be wiped away;
undefined for jealousy kindles a husband’s rage,and he will not show mercy when he takes revenge.
undefined He will not consider any compensation;he will not be willing, even if you multiply the compensation. Admonition to Avoid the Wiles of the Adulteress
My child, keep my wordsand treasure up my commands in your own keeping.
undefined Keep my commands so that you may live,and obey my instruction as your most prized possession.
undefined Bind them on your forearm;write them on the tablet of your heart.
undefined Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”and call understanding a close relative,
undefined so that they may keep you from the adulterous woman,from the loose woman who flatters you with her words.
undefined For at the window of my housethrough my window lattice I looked out
undefined and I saw among the naive – I discerned among the youths – a young man who lacked wisdom.
undefined He was passing by the street near her corner,making his way along the road to her house
undefined in the twilight, the evening,in the dark of the night.
undefined Suddenly a woman came out to meet him!She was dressed like a prostitute and with secret intent.
undefined (She is loud and rebellious,she does not remain at home –
undefined at one time outside, at another in the wide plazas,and by every corner she lies in wait.)
undefined So she grabbed him and kissed him,and with a bold expression she said to him,
undefined “I have fresh meat at home;today I have fulfilled my vows!
undefined That is why I came out to meet you,to look for you, and I found you!
undefined I have spread my bed with elegant coverings,with richly colored fabric from Egypt.
undefined I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
undefined Come, let’s drink deeply of lovemaking until morning,let’s delight ourselves with sexual intercourse.
undefined For my husband is not at home; he has gone on a journey of some distance.
undefined He has taken a bag of money with him;he will not return until the end of the month.”
undefined She persuaded him with persuasive words;with her smooth talk she compelled him.
undefined Suddenly he went after herlike an ox that goes to the slaughter,like a stag prancing into a trapper’s snare
undefined till an arrow pierces his liver – like a bird hurrying into a trap,and he does not know that it will cost him his life.
undefined So now, sons, listen to me,and pay attention to the words I speak.
undefined Do not let your heart turn aside to her ways – do not wander into her pathways;
undefined for she has brought down many fatally wounded,and all those she has slain are many.
undefined Her house is the way to the grave,going down to the chambers of death.The Appeal of Wisdom
Does not wisdom call out?Does not understanding raise her voice?
undefined At the top of the elevated places along the way,at the intersection of the paths she takes her stand;
undefined beside the gates opening into the city,at the entrance of the doorways she cries out:
undefined “To you, O people, I call out,and my voice calls to all mankind.
undefined You who are naive, discern wisdom!And you fools, understand discernment!
undefined Listen, for I will speak excellent things,and my lips will utter what is right.
undefined For my mouth speaks truth,and my lips hate wickedness.
undefined All the words of my mouth are righteous;there is nothing in them twisted or crooked.
undefined All of them are clear to the discerningand upright to those who find knowledge.
undefined Receive my instruction rather than silver,and knowledge rather than choice gold.
undefined For wisdom is better than rubies,and desirable things cannot be compared to her.
undefined “I, wisdom, live with prudence,and I find knowledge and discretion.
undefined The fear of the LORD is to hate evil;I hate arrogant pride and the evil wayand perverse utterances.
undefined Counsel and sound wisdom belong to me;I possess understanding and might.
undefined Kings reign by means of me,and potentates decree righteousness;
undefined by me princes rule,as well as nobles and all righteous judges.
undefined I love those who love me,and those who seek me find me.
undefined Riches and honor are with me,long-lasting wealth and righteousness.
undefined My fruit is better than the purest gold,and what I produce is better than choice silver.
undefined I walk in the path of righteousness,in the pathway of justice,
undefined that I may cause those who love me to inherit wealth,and that I may fill their treasuries.
undefined The LORD created me as the beginning of his works,before his deeds of long ago.
undefined From eternity I was appointed,from the beginning, from before the world existed.
undefined When there were no deep oceans I was born,when there were no springs overflowing with water;
undefined before the mountains were set in place – before the hills – I was born,
undefined before he made the earth and its fields,or the beginning of the dust of the world.
undefined When he established the heavens, I was there;when he marked out the horizon over the face of the deep,
undefined when he established the clouds above,when the fountains of the deep grew strong,
undefined when he gave the sea his decreethat the waters should not pass over his command,when he marked out the foundations of the earth,
undefined then I was beside him as a master craftsman,and I was his delight day by day,rejoicing before him at all times,
undefined rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth,and delighting in its people.
undefined “So now, children, listen to me;blessed are those who keep my ways.
undefined Listen to my instruction so that you may be wise,and do not neglect it.
undefined Blessed is the one who listens to me, watching at my doors day by day,waiting beside my doorway.
undefined For the one who finds me finds lifeand receives favor from the LORD.
undefined But the one who does not find me brings harm to himself;all who hate me love death.”The Consequences of Accepting Wisdom or Folly
Wisdom has built her house;she has carved out its seven pillars.
undefined She has prepared her meat, she has mixed her wine;she also has arranged her table.
undefined She has sent out her female servants;she calls out on the highest places of the city.
undefined “Whoever is naive, let him turn in here,”she says to those who lack understanding.
undefined “Come, eat some of my food,and drink some of the wine I have mixed.
undefined Abandon your foolish ways so that you may live,and proceed in the way of understanding.”
undefined Whoever corrects a mocker is asking for insult;whoever reproves a wicked person receives abuse.
undefined Do not reprove a mocker or he will hate you;reprove a wise person and he will love you.
undefined Give instruction to a wise person, and he will become wiser still;teach a righteous person and he will add to his learning.
undefined The beginning of wisdom is to fear the LORD,and acknowledging the Holy One is understanding.
undefined For because of me your days will be many,and years will be added to your life.
undefined If you are wise, you are wise to your own advantage,but if you are a mocker, you alone must bear it.
undefined The woman called Folly is brash,she is naive and does not know anything.
undefined So she sits at the door of her house,on a seat at the highest point of the city,
undefined calling out to those who are passing by her in the way,who go straight on their way.
undefined “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here,”she says to those who lack understanding.
undefined “Stolen waters are sweet,and food obtained in secret is pleasant!”
undefined But they do not realize that the dead are there,that her guests are in the depths of the grave.The First Collection of Solomonic Proverbs
The Proverbs of Solomon:A wise child makes a father rejoice,but a foolish child is a grief to his mother.
undefined Treasures gained by wickedness do not profit,but righteousness delivers from mortal danger.
undefined The LORD satisfies the appetite of the righteous,but he thwarts the craving of the wicked.
undefined The one who is lazy becomes poor,but the one who works diligently becomes wealthy.
undefined The one who gathers crops in the summer is a wise son,but the one who sleeps during the harvest is a son who brings shame to himself.
undefined Blessings are on the head of the righteous,but the speech of the wicked conceals violence.
undefined The memory of the righteous is a blessing,but the reputation of the wicked will rot.
undefined The wise person accepts instructions,but the one who speaks foolishness will come to ruin.
undefined The one who conducts himself in integrity will live securely,but the one who behaves perversely will be found out.
undefined The one who winks his eye causes trouble,and the one who speaks foolishness will come to ruin.
undefined The teaching of the righteous is a fountain of life, but the speech of the wicked conceals violence.
undefined Hatred stirs up dissension,but love covers all transgressions.
undefined Wisdom is found in the words of the discerning person, but the one who lacks wisdom will be disciplined.
undefined Those who are wise store up knowledge,but foolish speech leads to imminent destruction.
undefined The wealth of a rich person is like a fortified city,but the poor are brought to ruin by their poverty.
undefined The reward which the righteous receive is life;the recompense which the wicked receive is judgment.
undefined The one who heeds instruction is on the way to life,but the one who rejects rebuke goes astray.
undefined The one who conceals hatred utters lies,and the one who spreads slander is certainly a fool.
undefined When words abound, transgression is inevitable,but the one who restrains his words is wise.
undefined What the righteous say is like the best silver,but what the wicked think is of little value.
undefined The teaching of the righteous feeds many,but fools die for lack of wisdom.
undefined The blessing from the LORD makes a person rich,and he adds no sorrow to it.
undefined Carrying out a wicked scheme is enjoyable to a fool,and so is wisdom for the one who has discernment.
undefined What the wicked fears will come on him;what the righteous desire will be granted.
undefined When the storm passes through, the wicked are swept away,but the righteous are an everlasting foundation.
undefined Like vinegar to the teeth and like smoke to the eyes,so is the sluggard to those who send him.
undefined Fearing the LORD prolongs life,but the life span of the wicked will be shortened.
undefined The hope of the righteous is joy,but the expectation of the wicked will remain unfulfilled.
undefined The way of the LORD is like a stronghold for the upright, but it is destruction to evildoers.
undefined The righteous will never be moved,but the wicked will not inhabit the land.
undefined The speech of the righteous bears the fruit of wisdom, but the one who speaks perversion will be destroyed.
undefined The lips of the righteous know what is pleasing,but the speech of the wicked is perverse.
The LORD abhors dishonest scales,but an accurate weight is his elight.
undefined When pride comes, then comes disgrace,but with humility comes wisdom.
undefined The integrity of the upright guides them,but the crookedness of the unfaithful destroys them.
undefined Wealth does not profit in the day of wrath,but righteousness delivers from mortal danger.
undefined The righteousness of the blameless will make straight their way,but the wicked person will fall by his own wickedness.
undefined The righteousness of the upright will deliver them,but the faithless will be captured by their own desires.
undefined When a wicked person dies, his expectation perishes,and the hope of his strength perishes.
undefined The righteous person is delivered out of trouble,and the wicked turns up in his stead.
undefined With his speech the godless person destroys his neighbor,but by knowledge the righteous will be delivered.
undefined When the righteous do well, the city rejoices;when the wicked perish, there is joy.
undefined A city is exalted by the blessing provided from the upright,but it is destroyed by the counsel of the wicked.
undefined The one who denounces his neighbor lacks wisdom,but the one who has discernment keeps silent.
undefined The one who goes about slandering others reveals secrets,but the one who is trustworthy conceals a matter.
undefined When there is no guidance a nation falls,but there is success in the abundance of counselors.
undefined The one who puts up security for a stranger will surely have trouble,but whoever avoids shaking hands will be secure.
undefined A generous woman gains honor,and ruthless men seize wealth.
undefined A kind person benefits himself,but a cruel person brings himself trouble.
undefined The wicked person earns deceitful wages,but the one who sows righteousness reaps a genuine reward.
undefined True righteousness leads to life,but the one who pursues evil pursues it to his own death.
undefined The LORD abhors those who are perverse in heart,but those who are blameless in their ways are his delight.
undefined Be assured that the evil person will certainly be punished,but the descendants of the righteous will not suffer unjust judgment.
undefined Like a gold ring in a pig’s snoutis a beautiful woman who rejects discretion.
undefined What the righteous desire leads only to good,but what the wicked hope for leads to wrath.
undefined One person is generous and yet grows more wealthy,but another withholds more than he should and comes to poverty.
undefined A generous person will be enriched,and the one who provides water for others will himself be satisfied.
undefined People will curse the one who withholds grain,but they will praise the one who sells it.
undefined The one who diligently seeks good seeks favor,but the one who searches for evil – it will come to him.
undefined The one who trusts in his riches will fall,but the righteous will flourish like a green leaf.
undefined The one who troubles his family will inherit nothing,and the fool will be a servant to the wise person.
undefined The fruit of the righteous is like a tree producing life,and the one who wins souls is wise.
undefined If the righteous are recompensed on earth, how much more the wicked sinner!
The one who loves discipline loves knowledge,but the one who hates reproof is stupid.
undefined A good person obtains favor from the LORD,but the LORD condemns a person with wicked schemes.
undefined No one can be established through wickedness,but a righteous root cannot be moved.
undefined A noble wife is the crown of her husband,but the wife who acts shamefully is like rottenness in his bones.
undefined The plans of the righteous are just;the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
undefined The words of the wicked lie in wait to shed innocent blood,but the words of the upright will deliver them.
undefined The wicked are overthrown and perish,but the righteous household will stand.
undefined A person is praised in accordance with his wisdom,but the one who has a twisted mind is despised.
undefined Better is a person of humble standing who nevertheless has a servant,than one who pretends to be somebody important yet has no food.
undefined A righteous person cares for the life of his animal,but even the most compassionate acts of the wicked are cruel.
undefined The one who works his field will have plenty of food,but whoever chases daydreams lacks wisdom.
undefined The wicked person desires a stronghold,but the righteous root endures.
undefined The evil person is ensnared by the transgression of his speech,but the righteous person escapes out of trouble.
undefined A person will be satisfied with good from the fruit of his words, and the work of his hands will be rendered to him.
undefined The way of a fool is right in his own opinion,but the one who listens to advice is wise.
undefined A fool’s annoyance is known at once,but the prudent overlooks an insult.
undefined The faithful witness tells what is right,but a false witness speaks deceit.
undefined Speaking recklessly is like the thrusts of a sword,but the words of the wise bring healing.
undefined The one who tells the truth will endure forever,but the one who lies will last only for a moment.
undefined Deceit is in the heart of those who plot evil,but those who promote peace have joy.
undefined The righteous do not encounter any harm,but the wicked are filled with calamity.
undefined The LORD abhors a person who lies,but those who deal truthfully are his delight.
undefined The shrewd person conceals knowledge, but foolish people publicize folly.
undefined The diligent person will rule,but the slothful will become a slave.
undefined Anxiety in a person’s heart weighs him down,but an encouraging word brings him joy.
undefined The righteous person is cautious in his friendship,but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
undefined The lazy person does not roast his prey,but personal possessions are precious to the diligent.
undefined In the path of righteousness there is life,but another path leads to death.
A wise son accepts his father’s discipline,but a scoffer does not listen to rebuke.
undefined From the fruit of his speech a person eats good things,but the faithless desire the fruit of violence.
undefined The one who guards his words guards his life,but whoever is talkative will come to ruin.
undefined The appetite of the sluggard craves but gets nothing,but the desire of the diligent will be abundantly satisfied.
undefined The righteous person hates anything false,but the wicked person acts in shameful disgrace.
undefined Righteousness guards the one who lives with integrity,but wickedness overthrows the sinner.
undefined There is one who pretends to be rich and yet has nothing;another pretends to be poor and yet possesses great wealth.

undefined The one who oppresses the poor to increase his own gainand the one who gives to the rich – both end up only in poverty.The Sayings of the Wise
undefined Incline your ear and listen to the words of the wise,and apply your heart to my instruction.
undefined For it is pleasing if you keep these sayings within you,and they are ready on your lips.
undefined So that your confidence may be in the LORD, I am making them known to you today – even you.
undefined Have I not written thirty sayings for you,sayings of counsel and knowledge,
undefined to show you true and reliable words,so that you may give accurate answers to those who sent you?
undefined Do not exploit a poor person because he is poorand do not crush the needy in court,
undefined for the LORD will plead their caseand will rob those who are robbing them.
undefined Do not make friends with an angry person,and do not associate with a wrathful person,
undefined lest you learn his waysand entangle yourself in a snare.
undefined Do not be one who strikes hands in pledgeor who puts up security for debts.
undefined If you do not have enough to pay,your bed will be taken right out from under you!
undefined Do not move an ancient boundary stonewhich was put in place by your ancestors.
undefined Do you see a person skilled in his work?He will take his position before kings;he will not take his position before obscure people.
When you sit down to eat with a ruler,consider carefully what is before you,
undefined and put a knife to your throatif you possess a large appetite.
undefined Do not crave that ruler’s delicacies,for that food is deceptive.
undefined Do not wear yourself out to become rich;be wise enough to restrain yourself.
undefined When you gaze upon riches, they are gone,for they surely make wings for themselves,and fly off into the sky like an eagle!
undefined Do not eat the food of a stingy person,do not crave his delicacies;
undefined for he is like someone calculating the cost in his mind. “Eat and drink,” he says to you,but his heart is not with you;
undefined you will vomit up the little bit you have eaten,and will have wasted your pleasant words.
undefined Do not speak in the ears of a fool,for he will despise the wisdom of your words.
undefined Do not move an ancient boundary stone,or take over the fields of the fatherless,
undefined for their Protector is strong;he will plead their case against you.
undefined Apply your heart to instructionand your ears to the words of knowledge.
undefined Do not withhold discipline from a child;even if you strike him with the rod, he will not die.
undefined If you strike him with the rod,you will deliver him from death.
undefined My child, if your heart is wise,then my heart also will be glad;
undefined my soul will rejoicewhen your lips speak what is right.
undefined Do not let your heart envy sinners,but rather be zealous in fearing the LORD all the time.
undefined For surely there is a future,and your hope will not be cut off.
undefined Listen, my child, and be wise,and guide your heart on the right way.
undefined Do not spend time among drunkards,among those who eat too much meat,
undefined because drunkards and gluttons become impoverished,and drowsiness clothes them with rags.
undefined Listen to your father who begot you,and do not despise your mother when she is old.
undefined Acquire truth and do not sell it – wisdom, and discipline, and understanding.
undefined The father of a righteous person will rejoice greatly;whoever fathers a wise child will have joy in him.
undefined May your father and your mother have joy;may she who bore you rejoice.
undefined Give me your heart, my son,and let your eyes observe my ways;
undefined for a prostitute is like a deep pit;a harlot is like a narrow well.
undefined Indeed, she lies in wait like a robber,and increases the unfaithful among men.
undefined Who has woe? Who has sorrow?Who has contentions? Who has complaints?Who has wounds without cause? Who has dullness of the eyes?
undefined Those who linger over wine,those who go looking for mixed wine.
undefined Do not look on the wine when it is red,when it sparkles in the cup,when it goes down smoothly.

undefined for their hearts contemplate violence,and their lips speak harm.
undefined By wisdom a house is built,and through understanding it is established;
undefined by knowledge its rooms are filledwith all kinds of precious and pleasing treasures.

undefined Fear the LORD, my child, as well as the king,and do not associate with rebels,
undefined for suddenly their destruction will overtake them,and who knows the ruinous judgment both the LORD and the king can bring?Further Sayings of the Wise
undefined These sayings also are from the wise:To show partiality in judgment is terrible:
undefined The one who says to the guilty, “You are innocent,”peoples will curse him, and nations will denounce him.
undefined But there will be delight for those who convict the guilty,and a pleasing blessing will come on them.
undefined Like a kiss on the lipsis the one who gives an honest answer.
undefined Establish your work outside and get your fields ready;afterward build your house.
undefined Do not be a witness against your neighbor without cause,and do not deceive with your words.
undefined Do not say, “I will do to him just as he has done to me;I will pay him back according to what he has done.”
undefined I passed by the field of a sluggard,by the vineyard of one who lacks wisdom.
undefined I saw that thorns had grown up all over it, the ground was covered with weeds,and its stone wall was broken down.
undefined When I saw this, I gave careful consideration to it;I received instruction from what I saw:
undefined “A little sleep, a little slumber,a little folding of the hands to relax,
undefined and your poverty will come like a bandit,and your need like an armed robber.”Proverbs of Solomon Collected by Hezekiah
These also are proverbs of Solomon,which the men of King Hezekiah of Judah copied:
undefined It is the glory of God to conceal a matter,and it is the glory of a king to search out a matter.
undefined As the heaven is high and the earth is deepso the hearts of kings are unsearchable.
undefined Remove the dross from the silver,and material for the silversmith will emerge;
undefined remove the wicked from before the king,and his throne will be established in righteousness.
undefined Do not honor yourself before the king,and do not stand in the place of great men;
undefined for it is better for him to say to you, “Come up here,”than to put you lower before a prince,whom your eyes have seen.
undefined Do not go out hastily to litigation,or what will you do afterwardwhen your neighbor puts you to shame?
undefined When you argue a case with your neighbor,do not reveal the secret of another person,
undefined lest the one who hears it put you to shameand your infamy will never go away.
undefined Like apples of gold in settings of silver,so is a word skillfully spoken.
undefined Like an earring of gold and an ornament of fine gold,so is a wise reprover to the ear of the one who listens.
undefined Like the cold of snow in the time of harvest,so is a faithful messenger to those who send him,for he refreshes the heart of his masters.
undefined Like cloudy skies and wind that produce no rain,so is the one who boasts of a gift not given.
undefined Through patience a ruler can be persuaded,and a soft tongue can break a bone.
undefined When you find honey, eat only what is sufficient for you,lest you become stuffed with it and vomit it up.
undefined Don’t set foot too frequently in your neighbor’s house,lest he become weary of you and hate you.
undefined Like a club or a sword or a sharp arrow,so is the one who testifies against his neighbor as a false witness.
undefined Like a bad tooth or a foot out of joint,so is confidence in an unfaithful person at the time of trouble.
undefined Like one who takes off a garment on a cold day,or like vinegar poured on soda,so is one who sings songs to a heavy heart.
undefined If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat,and if he is thirsty, give him water to drink,
undefined for you will heap coals of fire on his head,and the LORD will reward you.
undefined The north wind brings forth rain,and a gossiping tongue brings forth an angry look.
undefined It is better to live on a corner of the housetopthan in a house in company with a quarrelsome wife.
undefined Like cold water to a weary person,so is good news from a distant land.
undefined Like a muddied spring and a polluted well,so is a righteous person who gives way before the wicked.
undefined It is not good to eat too much honey,nor is it honorable for people to seek their own glory.
undefined Like a city that is broken down and without a wall,so is a person who cannot control his temper.
Like snow in summer or rain in harvest,so honor is not fitting for a fool.
undefined Like a fluttering bird or like a flying swallow,so a curse without cause does not come to rest.
undefined A whip for the horse and a bridle for the donkey,and a rod for the backs of fools!
undefined Do not answer a fool according to his folly,lest you yourself also be like him.
undefined Answer a fool according to his folly,lest he be wise in his own estimation.
undefined Like cutting off the feet or drinking violence,so is sending a message by the hand of a fool.
undefined Like legs that hang limp from the lame,so is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
undefined Like tying a stone in a sling,so is giving honor to a fool.
undefined Like a thorn that goes into the hand of a drunkard,so is a proverb in the mouth of a fool.
undefined Like an archer who wounds at random,so is the one who hires a fool or hires any passer-by.
undefined Like a dog that returns to its vomit,so a fool repeats his folly.
undefined Do you see a man wise in his own eyes?There is more hope for a fool than for him.
undefined The sluggard says, “There is a lion in the road!A lion in the streets!”
undefined Like a door that turns on its hinges,so a sluggard turns on his bed.
undefined The sluggard plunges his hand in the dish;he is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth.
undefined The sluggard is wiser in his own estimationthan seven people who respond with good sense.
undefined Like one who grabs a wild dog by the ears,so is the person passing by who becomes furious over a quarrel not his own.
undefined Like a madman who shootsfirebrands and deadly arrows,
undefined so is a person who deceives his neighbor,and says, “Was I not only joking?”
undefined Where there is no wood, a fire goes out,and where there is no gossip, contention ceases.
undefined Like charcoal is to burning coals, and wood to fire,so is a contentious person to kindle strife.
undefined The words of a gossip are like delicious morsels;they go down into a person’s innermost being.
undefined Like a coating of glaze over earthenwareare fervent lips with an evil heart.
undefined The one who hates others disguises it with his lips,but he stores up deceit within him.
undefined When he speaks graciously, do not believe him,for there are seven abominations within him.
undefined Though his hatred may be concealed by deceit,his evil will be uncovered in the assembly.
undefined The one who digs a pit will fall into it;the one who rolls a stone – it will come back on him.
undefined A lying tongue hates those crushed by it,and a flattering mouth works ruin.
Do not boast about tomorrow;for you do not know what a day may bring forth.
undefined Let another praise you, and not your own mouth;someone else, and not your own lips.
undefined A stone is heavy and sand is weighty,but vexation by a fool is more burdensome than the two of them.
undefined Wrath is cruel and anger is overwhelming,but who can stand before jealousy?
undefined Better is open rebukethan hidden love.
undefined Faithful are the wounds of a friend,but the kisses of an enemy are excessive.
undefined The one whose appetite is satisfied loathes honey,but to the hungry mouth every bitter thing is sweet.
undefined Like a bird that wanders from its nest,so is a person who wanders from his home.
undefined Ointment and incense make the heart rejoice,likewise the sweetness of one’s friend from sincere counsel.
undefined Do not forsake your friend and your father’s friend,and do not enter your brother’s house in the day of your disaster;a neighbor nearby is better than a brother far away.
undefined Be wise, my son, and make my heart glad,so that I may answer anyone who taunts me.
undefined A shrewd person sees danger and hides himself,but the naive keep right on going and suffer for it.
undefined Take a man’s garment when he has given security for a stranger,and when he gives surety for a stranger, hold him in pledge.
undefined If someone blesses his neighbor with a loud voice early in the morning,it will be counted as a curse to him.
undefined A continual dripping on a rainy dayand a contentious wife are alike.
undefined Whoever hides her hides the windor grasps oil with his right hand.
undefined As iron sharpens iron,so a person sharpens his friend.
undefined The one who tends a fig tree will eat its fruit,and whoever takes care of his master will be honored.
undefined As in water the face is reflected as a face,so a person’s heart reflects the person.
undefined As Death and Destruction are never satisfied,so the eyes of a person are never satisfied.
undefined As the crucible is for silver and the furnace is for gold,so a person is proved by the praise he receives.
undefined If you should pound the fool in the mortaramong the grain with the pestle,his foolishness would not depart from him.
undefined Pay careful attention to the condition of your flocks,give careful attention to your herds,
undefined for riches do not last forever,nor does a crown last from generation to generation.
undefined When the hay is removed and new grass appears,and the grass from the hills is gathered in,
undefined the lambs will be for your clothing,and the goats will be for the price of a field.
undefined And there will be enough goat’s milk for your food,for the food of your household,and for the sustenance of your servant girls.
The wicked person flees when there is no one pursuing,but the righteous person is as confident as a lion.
undefined When a country is rebellious it has many princes,but by someone who is discerning and knowledgeable order is maintained.
undefined A poor person who oppresses the weakis like a driving rain without food.
undefined Those who forsake the law praise the wicked,but those who keep the law contend with them.
undefined Evil people do not understand justice,but those who seek the LORD understand it all.
undefined A poor person who walks in his integrity is betterthan one who is perverse in his ways even though he is rich.
undefined The one who keeps the law is a discerning child,but a companion of gluttons brings shame to his parents.
undefined The one who increases his wealth by increasing interestgathers it for someone who is gracious to the needy.
undefined The one who turns away his ear from hearing the law,even his prayer is an abomination.
undefined The one who leads the upright astray in an evil waywill himself fall into his own pit,but the blameless will inherit what is good.
undefined A rich person is wise in his own eyes,but a discerning poor person can evaluate him properly.
undefined When the righteous rejoice, great is the glory,but when the wicked rise to power, people are sought out.
undefined The one who covers his transgressions will not prosper,but whoever confesses them and forsakes them will find mercy.
undefined Blessed is the one who is always cautious,but whoever hardens his heart will fall into evil.
undefined Like a roaring lion or a roving bear,so is a wicked ruler over a poor people.
undefined The prince who is a great oppressor lacks wisdom,but the one who hates unjust gain will prolong his days.
undefined The one who is tormented by the murder of another will flee to the pit; let no one support him.
undefined The one who walks blamelessly will be delivered,but whoever is perverse in his ways will fall at once.
undefined The one who works his land will be satisfied with food,but whoever chases daydreams will have his fill of poverty.
undefined A faithful person will have an abundance of blessings,but the one who hastens to gain riches will not go unpunished.
undefined To show partiality is terrible,for a person will transgress over the smallest piece of bread.
undefined The stingy person hastens after richesand does not know that poverty will overtake him.
undefined The one who reproves another will in the end find more favorthan the one who flatters with the tongue.
undefined The one who robs his father and mother and says, “There is no transgression,”is a companion to the one who destroys.
undefined The greedy person stirs up dissension,but the one who trusts in the LORD will prosper.
undefined The one who trusts in his own heart is a fool,but the one who walks in wisdom will escape.
undefined The one who gives to the poor will not lack,but whoever shuts his eyes to them will receive many curses.
undefined When the wicked gain control, people hide themselves,but when they perish, the righteous increase.
The one who stiffens his neck after numerous rebukeswill suddenly be destroyed without remedy.
undefined When the righteous become numerous, the people rejoice;when the wicked rule, the people groan.
undefined The man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father,but whoever associates with prostitutes wastes his wealth.
undefined A king brings stability to a land by justice,but one who exacts tribute tears it down.
undefined The one who flatters his neighborspreads a net for his steps.
undefined In the transgression of an evil person there is a snare,but a righteous person can sing and rejoice.
undefined The righteous person cares for the legal rights of the poor;the wicked does not understand such knowledge.
undefined Scornful people inflame a city,but those who are wise turn away wrath.
undefined If a wise person goes to court with a foolish person,there is no peace whether he is angry or laughs.
undefined Bloodthirsty people hate someone with integrity;as for the upright, they seek his life.
undefined A fool lets fly with all his temper,but a wise person keeps it back.
undefined If a ruler listens to lies,all his ministers will be wicked.
undefined The poor person and the oppressor have this in common:the LORD gives light to the eyes of them both.
undefined If a king judges the poor in truth,his throne will be established forever.
undefined A rod and reproof impart wisdom,but a child who is unrestrained brings shame to his mother.
undefined When the wicked increase, transgression increases,but the righteous will see their downfall.
undefined Discipline your child, and he will give you rest;he will bring you happiness.
undefined When there is no prophetic vision the people cast off restraint,but the one who keeps the law, blessed is he!
undefined A servant cannot be corrected by words,for although he understands, there is no answer.
undefined Do you see someone who is hasty in his words?There is more hope for a fool than for him.
undefined If someone pampers his servant from youth,he will be a weakling in the end.
undefined An angry person stirs up dissension,and a wrathful person is abounding in transgression.
undefined A person’s pride will bring him low,but one who has a lowly spirit will gain honor.
undefined Whoever shares with a thief is his own enemy;he hears the oath to testify, but does not talk.
undefined The fear of people becomes a snare,but whoever trusts in the LORD will be set on high.
undefined Many people seek the face of a ruler,but it is from the LORD that one receives justice.
undefined An unjust person is an abomination to the righteous,and the one who lives an upright life is an abomination to the wicked.The Words of Agur
The words of Agur, the son of Jakeh; an oracle:This man says to Ithiel, to Ithiel and to Ukal:
undefined Surely I am more brutish than any other human being,and I do not have human understanding;
undefined I have not learned wisdom,nor do I have knowledge of the Holy One.

undefined Who has ascended into heaven, and then descended?Who has gathered up the winds in his fists?Who has bound up the waters in his cloak?Who has established all the ends of the earth?What is his name, and what is his son’s name? – if you know!
undefined Every word of God is purified;he is like a shield for those who take refuge in him.
undefined Do not add to his words,lest he reprove you, and prove you to be a liar.
undefined Two things I ask from you;do not refuse me before I die:
undefined Remove falsehood and lies far from me;do not give me poverty or riches,feed me with my allotted portion of bread,
undefined lest I become satisfied and act deceptivelyand say, “Who is the LORD?”Or lest I become poor and stealand demean the name of my God.
undefined Do not slander a servant to his master,lest he curse you, and you are found guilty.
undefined There is a generation who curse their fathersand do not bless their mothers.
undefined There is a generation who are pure in their own eyesand yet are not washed from their filthiness.
undefined There is a generation whose eyes are so lofty,and whose eyelids are lifted up disdainfully.
undefined There is a generation whose teeth are like swordsand whose molars are like knivesto devour the poor from the earthand the needy from among the human race.
undefined The leech has two daughters:“Give! Give!”There are three things that are never satisfied,four that never say, “Enough” –
undefined the grave, the barren womb,land that is not satisfied with water,and fire that never says, “Enough!”
undefined The eye that mocks at a fatherand despises obeying a mother – the ravens of the valley will peck it outand the young vultures will eat it.
undefined There are three things that are too wonderful for me,four that I do not understand:
undefined the way of an eagle in the sky,the way of a snake on a rock,the way of a ship in the sea,and the way of a man with a woman.
undefined This is the way of an adulterous woman:she eats and wipes her mouthand says, “I have not done wrong.”
undefined Under three things the earth trembles,and under four things it cannot bear up:
undefined under a servant who becomes king,under a fool who is stuffed with food,
undefined under an unloved woman who is married,and under a female servant who dispossesses her mistress.
undefined There are four things on earth that are small,but they are exceedingly wise:
undefined ants are creatures with little strength,but they prepare their food in the summer;
undefined rock badgers are creatures with little power,but they make their homes in the crags;
undefined locusts have no king,but they all go forward by ranks;
undefined a lizard you can catch with the hand,but it gets into the palaces of the king.
undefined There are three things that are magnificent in their step,four things that move about magnificently:
undefined a lion, mightiest of the beasts,who does not retreat from anything;
undefined a strutting rooster, a male goat,and a king with his army around him.
undefined If you have done foolishly by exalting yourselfor if you have planned evil,put your hand over your mouth!
undefined For as the churning of milk produces butterand as punching the nose produces blood,so stirring up anger produces strife.The Words of Lemuel
The words of King Lemuel,an oracle that his mother taught him:
undefined O my son, O son of my womb,O son of my vows,
undefined Do not give your strength to women,nor your ways to that which ruins kings.
undefined It is not for kings, O Lemuel,it is not for kings to drink wine,or for rulers to crave strong drink,
undefined lest they drink and forget what is decreed,and remove from all the poor their legal rights.
undefined Give strong drink to the one who is perishing,and wine to those who are bitterly distressed;
undefined let them drink and forget their poverty,and remember their misery no more.
undefined Open your mouth on behalf of those unable to speak,for the legal rights of all the dying.
undefined Open your mouth, judge in righteousness,and plead the cause of the poor and needy.The Wife of Noble Character
undefined Who can find a wife of noble character? For her value is far more than rubies.
undefined The heart of her husband has confidence in her,and he has no lack of gain.
undefined She brings him good and not evilall the days of her life.
undefined She obtains wool and flax,and she is pleased to work with her hands.
undefined She is like the merchant ships;she brings her food from afar.
undefined She also gets up while it is still night,and provides food for her household and a portion to her female servants.
undefined She considers a field and buys it;from her own income she plants a vineyard.
undefined She begins her work vigorously,and she strengthens her arms.
undefined She knows that her merchandise is good,and her lamp does not go out in the night.
undefined Her hands take hold of the distaff,and her hands grasp the spindle.
undefined She extends her hand to the poor,and reaches out her hand to the needy.
undefined She is not afraid of the snow for her household,for all of her household are clothed with scarlet.
undefined She makes for herself coverlets;her clothing is fine linen and purple.
undefined Her husband is well-known in the city gatewhen he sits with the elders of the land.
undefined She makes linen garments and sells them,and supplies the merchants with sashes.
undefined She is clothed with strength and honor,and she can laugh at the time to come.
undefined She opens her mouth with wisdom,and loving instruction is on her tongue.
undefined She watches over the ways of her household,and does not eat the bread of idleness.
undefined Her children rise up and call her blessed,her husband also praises her:
undefined “Many daughters have done valiantly,but you surpass them all!”
undefined Charm is deceitful and beauty is fleeting,but a woman who fears the LORD will be praised.
undefined Give her credit for what she has accomplished,and let her works praise her in the city gates.
